title: Project Music Inspirations?
body:
Now -when Project Zed & Friends came out, I HEARD some folks say that _Warframe_ as a game was an inspiration. A lot of people denied it, and said that Metal Gear Solid was the sole inspiration. I agree MGS was definitely apart of Yasuo.  But now I am sure, now that I've actually started playing Warframe I think it was apart of Zed and the Project theme music. Now the tagline for Warframe was always "Ninjas play free" and the theme was basically cyborg ninjas IN SPAAAAAACE.

Now, listen to the Project theme:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FYi2Bf7VAKo

Now listen to this  Warframe track by Keith Power @ 1m 35s to 2:21 called  synapse.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=euRlAUB8s6M


If you listen, you hear what parts influenced the LoL track.

And here is the _Ash_ warframe. {{champion:238}} 
http://warframe.wikia.com/wiki/Ash
His abilities are also reminiscent of Zed. Including the _"Death Mark"_ ability by name (lol Zed having come first though)

http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/warframe/images/c/c8/AshCodex.png/revision/latest?cb=20131121051051 http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Zed_3.jpg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OhbCKddWh7E

replies.body:
Hey Dreamspitter!
While I can't speak for Zed's design, the music for Project Yi was not inspired by the Warframe soundtrack. It's possible though, and probably likely, that both were inspired by similar 80s/tron/analogue synth genres. These arpeggio and pattern based musical components are quite common in those styles. Reading your post was the first time I actually got a chance to listen to Warframe's music.

> [{quoted}](name=Chemicalseb,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=puXAUYKQ,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-04-24T05:05:31.791+0000)
>
> Hey Dreamspitter!
> While I can't speak for Zed's design, the music for Project Yi was not inspired by the Warframe soundtrack. It's possible though, and probably likely, that both were inspired by similar 80s/tron/analogue synth genres. These arpeggio and pattern based musical components are quite common in those styles. Reading your post was the first time I actually got a chance to listen to Warframe's music.

Wow , a **composer**. I'm really surprised to hear back from a Rioter. This is a genre I know very little about -but there is in fact a retro vibe that has become one of those iconic parts of scifi. The roots of things can go very deep and stories, games, and art can share influences even if not directly between each other. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DSx_N18TWjs https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3F2pr2FbfQ
Btw just saying the new orianna skin looks like a warframe too :0
